bugPattern.name: Early Service Accept
bugPattern.description: Server accepts service request before key exchange has been completed (Property 3).

bugPattern.name: Unauthenticated Client
bugPattern.description: Server opens a channel with a client whose credentials were not successfully authenticated (Property 4).

bugPattern.name: Rekey Failure Pre-Authentication
bugPattern.description: Server refuses rekey after a service request is accepted, before authentication. (Property 5)

bugPattern.name: Rekey Failure Post-Authentication
bugPattern.description: Server refuses rekey with an authenticated client. (Property 5)

bugPattern.name: Continue After Disconnect
bugPattern.description: Server sends data after having received a DISCONNECT (Property 6).

bugPattern.name: Delayed NEWKEYS
bugPattern.description: After sending KEXINIT, server sends SR_ACCEPT or another KEXINIT, before sending NEWKEYS (Property 7).

bugPattern.name: Invalid SR Response
bugPattern.description: Server incorrectly responds to a service request. Conforming responses are either SR_ACCEPT or SR_DISCONNECT (Property 8).

bugPattern.name: Invalid Authentication Rejection Response
bugPattern.description: Server does not respond with a UA_FAILURE when rejecting an authentication request (Property 9).

bugPattern.name: Multiple UA_SUCCESS
bugPattern.description: UA_SUCCESS is produced multiple times (Property 10).

bugPattern.name: Missing UA_SUCCESS
bugPattern.description: UA_SUCCESS is missing (Property 10).

bugPattern.name: Unignored Authentication Request
bugPattern.description: An authentication request received after a UA_SUCCESS is not ignored (Property 11).

bugPattern.name: Unignored Authentication Request Rekey
bugPattern.description: An authentication request received after a UA_SUCCESS is not ignored, accounting for rekeying (Property 11).

bugPattern.name: Invalid Closure Response
bugPattern.description: Server does not respond to a CH_CLOSE with a CH_CLOSE (Property 12).

bugPattern.name: Missing NEWKEYS
bugPattern.description: Server sends upper layer message during a rekey, before receiving NEWKEYS.

bugPattern.name: Authentication Failure After Rekey
bugPattern.description: Following a rekey, client authentication using valid credentials is unsuccessful.

bugPattern.name: Channel Open Failure After Rekey
bugPattern.description: Following a rekey, attempt to open channel is not successful.

bugPattern.name: Request Failure After Rekey
bugPattern.description: Following a rekey, request to open PTY is not successful.

bugPattern.name: Multiple Kexinit
bugPattern.description: Server sends an additional KEXINIT during a key-exchange.

bugPattern.name: Termination After UNIMPL
bugPattern.description: Server terminates connection after sending UNIMPL, indicated by a NO_CONN response to CH_DATA.

bugPattern.name: Missing SR_AUTH
bugPattern.description: Authentication is performed without SR_AUTH.

generalBugPattern.name: Connection Layer Bug
generalBugPattern.description: There is a bug in the connection layer.
